startFire: Used to start a fire. Use on campfires, furnaces, etc. to light them or on an empty tile. Using this action may require kindling, tinder and a fuel item in your inventory depending on the circumstance.
carve: Used to carve creature corpses or to remove objects attached to the ground.
setDown: Using this item will place it on top of whatever tile is present in your facing direction. This is different than just dropping the item. It can also be used to extinguish fires.
eat: Consumed on use. May provide benefits to hunger, thirst, health and stamina; however, may reduce them as well depending on the food.
drinkItem: Consumed on use. Will reduce your thirst; however, will provide negative effects when drinking sea/unpurified water.
rest: Used to rest for a period of time to regain health and stamina. You will stop resting when reaching full stamina.
sleep: Used to sleep for a period of time to regain health and stamina. Duration is based on camping skill and time of day. A bonus to all effects (including length) will be granted if facing a fire or lit object. Hunger and dehydration increase slower while sleeping.
heal: Consumed on use. Used to restore a varied amount of health.
dig: Used to dig up resources and items from the ground.
paddle: Used to travel over water without getting your feet wet. Your speed is not reduced in water while paddling.
gatherWater: Used to gather water into the item.
shoot: You can shoot arrows with this item.
cast: Find a fish in a body of water and attempt to cast your line or net to catch it.
traverseTheSea: Used to travel to new, unexplored lands, leaving behind your current surroundings.
sling: You can sling bullets with this item.
repair: Use while facing a damaged item to attempt to repair it. Success based on skill used to make the item.
decode: Used for attempting to read the map. Use by the treasure location to reveal how far or close you are.
learn: Consumed on use. Reading usually provides useful crafting knowledge.
reinforce: Consumed on use. Use while facing a damaged item to attempt to increase the overall maximum and minimum durability. Success based on skill used to make the item.
gather: Can be used directly to gather from an adjacent resource tile/object. Gathering will attempt to gather everything, destroying the plant or mushroom in the process.
stokeFire: Used on a fire source to increase the strength of the flame.
pour: Pour on fire to extinguish the flames, pour inside a water still to begin water filtration, pour on a suitable plant to increase its health, or just simply empty out.
plant: Attempts to plant the item on the tile you are facing towards. Some plants may require certain ground types or conditions to be planted.
gatherTreasure: Attempt to gather a treasure in the vicinity of use based on a decoded treasure map. Range of gather is dependent on your mining skill.
ignite: Use this item on a fire source to start it on fire.
build: Attempt to construct or assemble the item on the tile you are facing towards.
openContainer: Using this will open it where you may drag and drop items to and from. Weight reduction and decay reduction bonuses may apply to items inside.
preserve: Used with food items to extend their life and decay rate.
openBottle: Consumed on use. Using this will open it, providing new and unknown items.
drinkCure: Consumed on use. Used to cure poisoning while sometimes providing other health benefits.
tellTime: Used to measure the time of day or night.
sailToCivilization: After collecting all the pieces of treasure, you can return to civilization and bask in the glory of your riches and fame. You can always return back to these lands afterwards.
transmogrify: Use while facing an equippable item to attempt to infuse with magical properties.
fire: Using a mixture of black powder along with a bullet, you may fire this weapon.
teleport: With a flick of the wand, teleport to a location in front of where you are facing.
extinguish: Douse the torch, extinguishing the flame.
drawMap: Draw a map using your skill in cartography of the surrounding area.
pourOnYourself: Liquid is consumed on use. Used to sooth burn injuries.
squeeze: Consumed on use. Spews a stream of fire in your facing direction.
healCreature: Consumed on use. Used to restore a varied amount of health to a creature.
rubClockwise: Rubbing this item manifests its effects to the holder.
rubCounterclockwise: Rubbing this item manifests its effects to the holder.
grasp: Used to pick-up items using another item for safety reasons such as grasping items in a fire.
till: Use while facing a tile you wish to till, granting it properties for better plant growth.
harvest: Can be used to harvest an adjacent plant or mushroom without destroying the plant itself.
gatherMilk: Attempt to gather milk from a creature you are facing.
read: Open the book and read the contents.

islandPresence:
"This island seems to react to my presence. I often have a weird feeling, like something is watching me, but besides the constant barrage of bloodthirsty creatures at my heels, that feeling never leaves me; it follows me even into my dreams. I'm not sure how many more sleepless nights I can lead."

"There it is again. I felled a tree. I hear it."

"There it is again. I burned a tree. The humming continues."

"There it is again, the end. I started a forest fire. It's too loud!"

The next pages have undecipherable scribbles and diagrams.
treasure:
"The greed that has driven us to these islands now forces us to stay here. Day after day we search for the treasures that brought us to these lands to begin with. Our group of men have discovered several different types of treasure, some even from slaying the ravenous indigenous creatures that seem to roam these islands and caves. But we cannot seem to leave, we need more. The island demands it."

The next pages seem to be ripped out and missing.

"We have failed. Many have perished. We are missing the final piece. I do not think we can make it much further. We seem to have angered nature itself."
deities:
The book has the inscription, "Deities" on the spine.

"The same three strange symbols seem to appear again and again on artifacts, cave walls, and even old long-ago abandoned buildings. Cross referencing other resources and even some older journals we have found references to deities, spirits, and even Gods. Most likely worshiped by the heathens that used to inhabit these lands. They seem connected to these islands somehow."

"The three names seem to be mentioned again and again, Wry, Da, and Aw."
pastCivilizations:
"We have discovered evidence of many battles here. Not only that, but civilizations, skeletal remains, abandoned houses, and much evidence to support some type of apocalyptic scenario."

"Not only that, but it seems to happen again and again; the evidence all points to different ages and different points in time. It appears as though no people are able to survive and thrive in these lands, like some force is forbidding human progress."

"These ravenous, unabating creatures are not helping matters, that's for sure."
sandCasting:
The entire book seems to be stained with various chemicals and powders.

"Throughout my metallurgic experiments, I have found the best way to forge iron and copper based tools, weapons, and ingots was to cast large amounts of material to shape it. The best casting method I have found using resources around me was sand casting."

"The primary ingredient for creating a sand cast is greensand, a mixture of clay flakes and refined sand. This allows for the malleability of creating the shape of tool and weapon heads, or even forming the ingots in which to work from."

"Next, we place the greensand in a flask, crafted with wood, finishing the build of the sand cast flask. We then set the shape, place down some talc powder so the finished produce can be lifted easier, and pour the molten smelted mixture into the cast to let it set and harden."

The book is adorned with crude drawings of each process.

"I have also found I can use limestone powder as the flux to refine ores and remove impurities in the smelting process."

The bottom of the paged is signed with "James Townsend, the Smithy".

slime: A bouncing globule of animated gelatin. It is not aware of your stirring.
jellyCube: An animated cube of gelatin. Its body jiggles to-and-fro as it moves towards you with hostile intent.
giantSpider: A gangly, frightful arachnid with the ability to poison you.
bear: A hulking carnivorous mammal attracted to your scent. A deadly foe without protection.
rabbit: A fast moving, peaceful herbivorous mammal. Useful for a good meal or as a pet.
snake: A slithering, poisonous reptile. Appears ambivalent to your encroachment.
giantRat: A rat of unusual size with sharp claws and piercing teeth. Keep at a distance without equipment.
rat: A small and scurrying rodent. Afraid of predators, it will try to escape your grasp.
vampireBat: A flying mammal with large rubbery wings. Appears to have a penchant for human blood.
greyWolf: A tall canid animal. Able to tear into flesh with vicious abandon.
imp: An odd hovering creature with thick wrinkled skin and sharp claws.
bogling: A foul, sulphurous-smelling writhing mass of vegetation, seemingly animated and alive.
livingRock: A massive pile of rocks and minerals that appears to be alive, or semi-aware at least.
shark: A large blood-thirsty cartilaginous sea creature. Its fin juts from the waters, taunting you.
zombie: A slow, but strong foul-smelling undead or diseased human. Appears to dislike the sun.
skeleton: An animated pile of human, or human-like bones.
pirateGhost: A glowing, ethereal visage of a pirate. It appears to be able to manifest a physical weapon to attack you.
timeSkitter: An unusual spider-like creature that appears to be able to move through solid objects and move at incredible speeds.
chicken: A flightless fowl that seems fearful of your presence. Produces feathers, eggs, meat, and more.
trapdoorSpider: A large spider that appeared from an underground dwelling as you stumbled over it.
fireElemental: A creature that is seemingly composed of only fire. Appears to spread fire and destruction in its wake.
cod: A common ocean fish, known for it's nutritionally-dense, flaky white flesh.
hobgoblin: An odd-looking humanoid. Dislikes your presence and appears to know how to use traps.
livingMushroom: A living mycological abomination. It appears to have a vengeful attitude towards you.
kraken: A wiry mass of thick tentacles, this lumbering sea-giant is angered by your existence.
blindfish: A cave-dwelling, sightless fish. Hard to see in detail within the murky depths.
harpy: A large and unusual avian creature. Hostile to your presence.
acidSpitterDemon: A small, but fierce demonic-looking creature with sharp claws. Appears to spit an acidic fluid.
skeletalMage: A robed, magic-casting skeletal humanoid. It appears to hold a wand; flicking it to cast its spells.
clawWorm: A wriggling creature with a massive claw-mouth, spawned forth from the ground due to vibrations caused by your gathering.
drake: A massive flightless lizard-dragon with large scales and the ability to breath fire. A fearsome foe.
sandcat: A small, but ferocious feline that lives exclusively in desert areas.
lavaBeetle: A horned beetle with a large abdomen, filled with liquid magma.
goat: A hardy ruminant animal that has horns. A frisky, lively creature, but dangerous when provoked, ramming at its target with much force.
slitherSucker: A wriggling foreign-looking worm-like creature. Its mouth is wide and is filled with suction modules and razor sharp teeth.

woodenFence: A set of panels, usually used to keep creatures inside.
woodenWall: A wall crafted by connecting wooden logs together.
clayBrickWall: A wall made from fired clay bricks.
sandstoneWall: A robust wall created from sandstone.
stoneWall: A hardy wall built from rocks.
setExplosiveTrap: An elaborate trap, ready to be triggered and exploded by touch.
setDeadfall: A constructed deadfall, ready to fall and crush a creature.
setSnare: A constructed snare, ready to trap a creature's appendage.
setHobgoblinSnare: A hobgoblin constructed snare, ready to catch your feet or an unsuspecting creature.
solarStill: A constructed solar still, desalinating water through evaporation.
woodenChest: A chest used for stockpiling items and preserving food.
lockedWoodenChest: A locked chest, too heavy to move. Able to be broken or lockpicked.
creatureIdol: An odd mass of organs. A hum emanates from it, seemingly attracting creatures.
grass: A small mound of growing grass.
clematis: A wiry tangle of thin vines with leaves.
milkThistles: A couple milk thistles, known for their medicinal properties.
buttonMushrooms: A few possibly edible common-looking white mushrooms.
switchgrass: A collection of long grass, suitable for cordage.
badderlocks: A gathering of long seaweed, useful for eating or cordage.
chives: A bunch of bright green chives planted in to the ground.
pineapple: A large spikey plant, with a ripened pineapple fruit contained inside when mature.
pileOfRocks: A mass of rocks, stuck into the ground.
raspberryBush: A small bush, bearing small amounts of raspberries.
beggarticks: A grouping of bright yellow medicinal flowers.
cotton: A white and fluffy cotton plant, an indispensable plant for fiber.
pricklyPears: Spined cacti, known for its edible fruit and pads with their pointy needles.
deadBush: A sparse, dried out mass of twigs.

acid: A neon-green ooze; boiling and bubbling into the ground.
caveEntrance: An entrance into the the dark caverns below.
woodenDoorOpen: An open door, allowing anything to enter.
woodenGate: A gate, used as a passage through connected fences.
woodenGateOpen: An opened gate, allowing anything to escape or enter.
poisonIvy: A creeping plant with leaves of three.
wroughtIronChest: A large chest, used for storage and keeping edibles fresher.
ironChest: An iron container for storing items and reducing food decay.
ornateWoodenChest: A decorative chest used for storing items and preserving perishables.
skeletalRemains: A pile of bones that appear to be stirring.
clayKiln: A high-temperature fire enclosure made from clay.
litClayKiln: A lit clay kiln, ready for firing items.
clayCampfire: An organized circle of clay bricks, used to contain a fire.
litClayCampfire: A lit fire inside an enclosure of clay bricks.

litClayFurnace: A lit clay furnance, ready to be used in production.
clayWaterStill: A clay water still, ready to be lit to desalinate water.
litClayWaterStill: A lit clay water still, desalinating water through evaporation.
sandstoneCampfire: An organized circle of sandstone, used to contain a fire.
litSandstoneCampfire: A lit fire inside an enclosure of sandstone.
sandstoneFurnace: A sandstone furnace for creating an enclosed high-temperature fire.
litSandstoneFurnace: A lit sandstone furnance, ready to be used in production.
sandstoneWaterStill: A sandstone water still, ready to be lit to desalinate water.
litSandstoneWaterStill: A lit sandstone water still, desalinating water through evaporation.
stoneKiln: A high-temperature fire enclosure made from stone.
litStoneKiln: A lit stone kiln, ready for firing items.
wroughtIronAnvil: A wrought iron anvil, used for blacksmithing with a fire source.
ironAnvil: An iron anvil used for metalworking. Used in addition with a fire source.
mapleTree: A common maple tree, known for its distinctive leaf and seed shape.
appleTree: A deciduous tree known for its sweet, pomaceous fruit; the apple.
spruceTree: A large and robust spruce tree. Known for its whorled branches and conical form.
cypressTree: A tall and gangly conifer tree. Although sparse in foliage, it makes up for it with healthy supply of hardwood.
coconutTree: A tall palm tree, able to produce life-sustaining coconut fruit when mature.
lettuce: An edible leafy plant that could almost be mistaken for a weed when growing.

welcomeToWayward:
Welcome to the Early Access version of Wayward! Wayward is currently in beta status and many things will change and improve over time. Hint windows like these will display as you play the game if enabled. You can disable automatic hints by clicking the button "Disable Hints" below or in the options. If you need further help or hints, visit the Steam Discussions forums.

If you want to keep up with Wayward, please visit the Wayward Website, Subreddit, or Discord.

Want to help Wayward? Spread the word, or follow us on one of the following sites: Facebook, Twitter, or IndieDB.
controls:
Keybinds can be changed under "Keybinds" in the Options menu.

Window Shortcuts


{Bindable.GamePause}: Pause Menu
{Bindable.DialogCloseAll}: Close All Dialogs
{Bindable.DialogInventory}: Inventory
{Bindable.DialogEquipment}: Equipment
{Bindable.DialogCrafting}: Crafting
{Bindable.DialogHelp}: Help
{Bindable.DialogSkills}: Skills
{Bindable.DialogMessages}: Messages
{Bindable.DialogOptions}: Options
{Bindable.GameActions}: Actions
{Bindable.DialogMilestones}: Milestones
For more binds, see the Controls section of the Options menu.

Movement


To move, you can use {Bindable.GameMoveUp}, {Bindable.GameMoveLeft}, {Bindable.GameMoveDown}, {Bindable.GameMoveRight} to move up, left, down, or right, respectively, or press {Bindable.GameMoveDirection}, to move towards your mouse. To skip/pass a turn, or to pick up item(s) on the tile you are standing on, press {Bindable.GameIdle} or use {Bindable.GameMoveDirection} with your mouse over your character. If you want to face a direction without moving, you can hold down {Bindable.GameFaceDirection} and your character will face towards your mouse. You can also use {Bindable.GameFaceUp}, {Bindable.GameFaceLeft}, {Bindable.GameFaceDown}, or {Bindable.GameFaceRight} to face up, left, down, or right, again, respectively. If there is too much or too little delay between turning a direction and moving, you can fine-tune it in the Gameplay section of the Options menu.

Actions


Opening up the Actions menu ({Bindable.GameActions}) will bring up a list of actions you can perform on the adjacent tile or object; for example, collecting a pineapple without needing to carve it up. Jumping is also selectable in the actions menu which can help you get out of tight spots, but watch out for the heavy stamina reduction; it's based on your current weight.

Using Items


Use {Bindable.GameItemMenu} when hovering over an item with the mouse to bring up a list of actions you can perform with the item. Using quickslots, you may also perform actions with an item at the press of a bind. To quickslot an item, use the action "Add to Quickslot", drag the item to a quickslot, or press any of the quickslot binds ({Bindable.GameQuickSlot1}, {Bindable.GameQuickSlot2}, etc). Once an item is quickslotted, you can use its configured action at any time by pressing its quickslot bind.

Item Management


To drop an item quickly, you may press {Bindable.GameItemDrop} when hovering over an item. You can also use the "Drop All" option from the item's menu or press {Bindable.GameItemDropAll} to drop multiple of the same kind of item. If there is a tile in the way of your drop, nothing will happen. You may change this functionality and instead drop the item at your feet with the setting "Drop at Feet When Blocked", available in the Gameplay section of the Options menu and the Quick Settings dialog.

To move an item quickly from your inventory to a container or vice-versa, you may press {Bindable.GameItemQuickMove} when hovering an item. If there is no open container and there is a container in the direction your character is facing, you will place the item into the container. You may also press {Bindable.GameItemQuickMoveAll} to move all items of the same type.

More Information


Hovering over elements on screen will typically reveal more information. Tooltips will appear over items. Hovering over crafting items will highlight items used in the craft. Many objects in the world also have tooltips, unless they are disabled. If they are disabled, you can still get information about the tile you are hovering over with {Bindable.GameInspect}.
corpseCarving: To harvest potential resources from corpses, you must carve them with a sharp item. Choose "Carve" from the item's menu or try moving it to a quickslot for ease of use.
doodads:
Doodads are considered objects attached to the ground like plants, piles of rocks, furnaces, campfires, etc. To collect them, you can do one of the following:

1. While facing the item, click or press the "Actions" ({Bindable.GameActions}), and select the "Collect Object With Hands" option.
2. Use an item with "Digging" such as a stone shovel.
3. Use an item with "Carving" such as a sharp rock.
4. Use an item with "Gather" such as a wooden pole.
5. Use an item with "Harvest" such as a stone knife.

Using your bare hands with no tool (option 1) can sometimes harm you. Using a tool (option 2/3/4/5) will decrease the durability of the item. Some objects may require a "Carving" tool such as corpses to harvest from them.
caves: Caves are the perfect place for hidden treasure, but first, they may need illumination with a torch to explore them further. Caves can be extremely dangerous and may require advanced armor and weaponry.
nightfall: If nightfall is approaching, find a safe area to camp out and prepare yourself for combat! Many tough creatures can prowl the night.
staminaReplenishment: If you find yourself getting exhausted, sleep or rest using a bedroll or hammock to regenerate stamina. You can also rest by going into the Actions menu and selecting "Rest"; however, resting with an item will produce better regenerative effects. Rest is different from sleep in that you will only ever rest until your stamina is maxed out. Alternatively, you may hold spacebar or click your character to skip turns.
healthProblems: If you find yourself injured, you replenish your health with food or healing-type items. Some status effects reduce your ability to regenerate your health including bleeding and poisoning. Alternatively, you can also try sleeping or resting to regenerate health.
bleeding: The bleeding status effect is usually the result of a low anatomy skill percentage while fighting a tough creature. Make sure to use a healing item to stop the bleeding, such as a bandage or tourniquet. Bleeding causes you to starve/dehydrate faster, regenerate stamina slower, and stops regeneration of health.
poisoned: Poisoning can happen from eating bad things or from some types of creatures. Make sure to use a curing item to cure the poison, such as medicinal water. Poisoning causes you to starve/dehydrate faster, regenerate stamina slower, and stops regeneration of health.
dehydration: There's many ways to get drinkable water, but unfortunately for you, the largest source of water, from the sea is nearly undrinkable in its raw form. You must desalinate the water through the use of a water still or flask before drinking it without adverse effects. Alternatively, you may seek out a fresh water source, such as from caves, small lakes, oases, swamps or ponds. Fresh water is drinkable in it's raw form without too many bad effects; however, you may still want to boil it for the best health results.
useATool:
Gathering resources with your hands is difficult and harmful; try equipping or using a tool to eliminate the chance of injury. Quickslotting an item can help you control the exact tool you wish to use for fast usage.

If you are mining or lumberjacking, your weapon(s) attack value will also help gather items faster. Blunt attack weapon will help you gather faster while mining, while slashing weapons will help you gather faster while lumberjacking.
durability: If you find your armor, tools or weapons are close to breaking from overuse (highlighted with a red border), you will need to repair it using a hammer item or a grindstone. If you can't find or craft an item to repair it, it will soon break completely upon use.
death: Death is permanent. Although you may have died, all of the crafting recipes you have discovered will be ready on your next playthrough. Your milestones will also carry over, providing you multiple starting benefits.
consumingBadThings: Ow! Not all edible/drinkable objects should be consumed, at least not without facing the consequences. On the other hand, sometimes it's worth the risk to gain its other effects. Consuming bad things can sometimes result in poisoning.
fastPickup: You have just picked up an item from the ground. Sometimes there are multiple items on a tile. Pressing the spacebar or clicking on your character will gather items underneath you without moving. Alternatively, you can pick-up all items on a tile by facing the stack, opening the actions menu with {Bindable.GameActions}, and selecting "Pick-up All Items".
bugs: Did you find an error? Would you kindly let us know about what happened, so that we may seek to stop this from happening to other players? You can do so by posting the issue in the Steam Discussions Bug Reports forum.
heldItems:
Your left and right hand equipment slots are interchangeable. You can equip two weapons, two tools, two shields or any combination in between. With both the left and right hand options selected, you will use both hands (and whatever is equipped in each slot) in combat and in gathering. You can disable either the left or right hands to disable using that one in attacking and gathering. Disabling both will prevent you from attacking or gathering automatically.

To receive a parrying defense bonus, you must be holding an item in each hand (one to parry with, one to fight with).
milestones: Milestones are personalized goals and achievements. Each playthrough, you are given an amount to either discover or work towards. Milestones are saved after each playthrough or death. The more you have completed, the more starting skill and stat points you get, as well as more starting items.
burned: Lasting burn injuries and pain can be caused from stepping in an open flame without protection, or possibly other sources. Pouring liquid on yourself will soothe the injuries and pain. Alternatively, you can also take a swim in deep water. Keep swimming until the effect subsides. Being burned will stop you from regenerating health and can last awhile if untreated.
crafting:
Crafting is simple, but has many rules!

When hovering over an item in the crafting window, you will see which items will be used in the craft through a highlighted border that will appear around items in your inventory. You will also notice that you will use the first instance of a required item. Simply drag around the order of items in your inventory or use the sort to use different items in the craft.

Using items in a craft that have lower durability will affect the crafted item's durability. Additionally, using remarkable, exceptional or legendary items in a craft increases your chances to craft such an item. Decayable items (such as food) also gain decay bonuses from using higher quality items in the craft.

You can find new crafting recipes by gathering the required items in your inventory and by finding old instructional scrolls.
encumberance: The first level of encumberance will slow down your movement and reduce stamina regeneration. The second level, "overburdened" will physically hurt you as you will begin to take damage while trying to move. You can drop items from your inventory by right clicking, through the item's menu, or by dragging and dropping them on to the game screen.
movingItems:
There are many ways to organize and move items in Wayward.

1. Drag and Drop: By holding {Bindable.GameItemMove}, you may drag and drop items into a container window, quickslot, equipment slot, or directly on to the ground. Dragging and dropping to the game screen will drop it in front of you, or inside a chest if you are facing one.
2. Quickmoving: With {Bindable.GameItemQuickMove} you can move an item instantly from your inventory to a container or vice-versa. You can use this while the container is not open, if your character is facing towards it. You may also use {Bindable.GameItemQuickMoveAll} to instantly move all items of the same type. 2. From the item's menu: Right clicking an item will display the item's menu with options to "Drop/Drop All", or if you have a container window open, will present you the option to "Move/Move All". If you click an item that has a special quality, additional options will be visible to Drop/Move all of the same quality.
3. Dropping items: By pressing {Bindable.GameItemDrop}, you may drop an item onto the ground. If the tile in front of you is blocked, nothing will happen, or the item will be dropped at your feet, if your Drop Location is set to "Drop at Feet When Blocked". You may also press {Bindable.GameItemDropAll} to drop all items of the same type.
craftingFailure:
All crafts in Wayward have a skill level assosiated with them. Hovering over each craft will reveal the item's craft skill level. These levels going from easiest to harder are: simple, intermediate, advanced, and expert.

Trying to craft an item with a higher skill level than your own crafting skill can sometimes result in failure. Your chance to successfully craft the item raises as your skills increase. If the item's skill level appears in orange, you will have a low chance at success for crafting that item. Each unsucessful attempt at crafting will reduce the durability of each item involved in the craft.
reputation:
These lands are mysterious and seem to react to your presence and actions. Crafting and using items, killing creatures, and performing skills will all effect your malignity and benignity, and thus your reputation. The lower your reputation becomes, the more challenging survival becomes. Having a high reputation assumes you are peaceful, and these lands will act in kindness towards you by not allowing more difficult creatures to spawn. Certain peaceful actions may increase your reputation and benignity such as gardening or planting mushrooms and plants. Travelling away to other lands using boats can significantly increase your reputation as well.

Caves will always feature the same creatures, regardless of reputation and during the night, if your reputation is below 0, some very dangerous creatures can spawn.
interface:
The windowed interface in Wayward is completely customizable. You can move them around as you see fit, and resize them to expand the information that is viewable. Move them around by dragging the title bar of each window. Resize them by dragging the corner of the window.

If you are still having issues finding certain items within the inventory or crafting windows, try using the filter or sorting features.
creatureTaming:
Violence is sometimes not the best option! Besides running away from a confrontation with the hostile island creatures, another option is to attempt to tame them. To attempt creature taming, simply face the creature and select "Tame" from your action menu (opened with {Bindable.GameActions}).

Sometimes attempting to calm the creature directly will not be enough. You can also attempt to offer an item to creature. Simply face the creature, open a item's menu and select "Offer". If the creature likes or wants the item, it will become tamed. Aberrant creatures can sometimes require multiple item offerings before they will become tamed. All of these actions are based on chance and your taming skill.
combat:
Engaging in combat with creatures may not be the best option. In Wayward, you are free to attempt to kill creatures as well as tame or flee from them. The strategy is up to you!

Many skills play an important role in your successfulness at slaying the creature. Open your skills window using {Bindable.DialogSkills} and view the hints provided when hovering over skills such as tactics and parrying. Skills are not the only important factor when battling creatures. Your weaponry and armaments also play a role. The combat messages will tell you of your effectivenesses and inadequacies when in combat. When holding two items (one in each hand), you will also receive a parrying defense bonus (based on your parrying skill).
quickslots:
Opening an item's menu to perform actions can be tiresome. Quickslots are for using an action on an item with the press of a bind.

Quickslotting an Item


You can drag any item into one of your 9 quickslots to quickslot the item in that slot. You can also use any of the quickslot binds to toggle the item being quickslotted to the slot of the bind you press.
Alternatively, you can open an item's menu and select "Add to Quickslot" to add it to an open quickslot.

Using a Quickslotted Item


By default, pressing the bind for a quickslot will perform the default action for the item in that slot. You can change the action to perform for a quickslot item by opening the actions menu for the item in the quickslot, and clicking the x icon next to the preferred action, turning it into a √.

Removing a Quickslotted Item


There are two binds provided for removing items from quickslots. You can press {Bindable.GameQuickSlotClear} to clear the hovered item from its quickslot, or to clear the hovered quickslot. You can also press any of the quickslot binds to toggle the hovered item being quickslotted to that slot.
resourceGathering:
To gather resources from trees or rocks, simply move into them (this feature can be disabled in options). You may not always succeed in gathering materials (the chances are based on your skill and tool). You will use whatever is in your hands to gather. You can choose what tool specifically is used in either your left or right hand by selecting which to use at the bottom of your equipment menu. It is harmful to try to resource gather without tools.

Alternatively, if you do not want to use what you are holding, you can use an item's "Gather" action from its menu. You can make this easier by quickslotting it. Review the "Quickslots" hint for more information on this functionality.

Some resources are not gathered in this fashion. Things like small plants and other objects attached to the ground (referred to as doodads) require different methods. Review the "Doodads" hint for more information on these items.
multiplayer:
Multiplayer in Wayward is enabled for up to 32 players. Multiplayer works on a simulated real-time mode where each turn happens on a fixed interval. Casual and Hardcore modes work a bit differently than in single player. Casual mode allows players to respawn as per normal, but in Hardcore mode, when you die you will continue to play in ghost form, allowing you to spectate but not interact normally. Multiplayer also allows for a special PVP flag to be set to allow players to hurt and kill other players. Multiplayer options can be set in the multiplayer menu via the pause menu accessed with {Bindable.GamePause}.

Creature spawn rates, creature difficulty, and reputation are all based on how many connected players there are and will scale and average based on each individual player.

Commands


You can use several special commands while playing multiplayer. To see a list of all possible commands, type "/commands" in the chat bar and hit enter. The following commands are also available for use:

/players – Shows a list of all connected players.
/ping – Shows your latency to the host player.
/kick – Allows the host to kick a player.
/banned – Shows a list of all banned players.
/ban – Allows the host to ban a player.
/unban – Allows the host to unban a player.
gardening:
The full plant life cycle is represented in Wayward. In order, these are: germinating, seedling, vegetative, budding, flowering, ripening, and dead. Fungus follows the same steps, but are named: germinating, spreading, forming, young, fruiting, and full.

Each of the steps means something different for each plant and fungus. Every plant is unique, including the resources you can gather or harvest from each of them. If you attempt to gather from a plant too early, you may not get the full amount of resources.

Gathering is a destructive process, meaning, you will attempt to gather everything from the plant. Some vegetables and fruits require this to get the edible portion, such as potatoes or carrots for example.

Harvesting a plant will only attempt to get what will keep the plant alive and/or sustainable. This is not always an option for all plants, and sometimes will only result in getting their seeds.

You can attempt to water plants (by using the "Pour" action on water containers) or plant them on fertile soil to reduce their growth time and increase their fertility for spreading.

amber: Окаменевшая древесная смола. Можно расплавить для усиления предметов.
animalSkull: Большой выдолбленный, отбеленный череп животного, из которого можно сделать простой шлем.
stoneArrow: Снаряд для стрельбы из лука, изготовленный из наконечника стрелы и пера для управления полётом.
stoneArrowhead: Изготовлен из камня и используется для изготовления стрел. Может также использоваться как резьбовое устройство.
barkLeggings: Примитивные поножи, изготовленные из жёсткой древесной коры и скреплённая жилой.
barkShield: Самодельный щит, используемый для блокирования атак, изготовленный из древесной коры и обмотанный жилой.
barkTunic: Нагрудник из древесной коры, связанный жилой.
bone: Тяжёлая, отбеленная солнцем кость животного, подходящая для примитивного боя, сбора или изготовления более полезных предметов.
branch: Обычная ветка дерева, полезная в различном ремесле или разжигания огня.
cactusSpines: Тонкие, длинные шипы, пригодные для изготовления примитивных игл.
cobblestoneFlooring: Примитивный настил, созданный путём размещения камней в организованном порядке, заполняя любые промежутки.
cookedMeat: Достаточно нагретое мясо, безопасное и готовое к употреблению.
earthworm: Живое извивающееся насекомое, эффективно для использования в качестве приманки или поедания.
feather: Какое-то яркое белое оперение от какой-то птицы.
fertilizer: Богатая смесь органических материалов и химикатов, пригодная для сочетания с почвой для создания плодородной почвы.
waterskinOfSeawater: Бурдюк, наполненный морской водой, непригодной для питья без опреснения.
firePlough: Устройство для розжига, которое использует метод палки и углубления для выработки тепла через трение.
beggartickSeeds: Высушенные семена байдены, которые можно посадить для выращивания цветов.
goldCoins: Блестящие золотые монеты неизвестной вам утраченной цивилизации.
goldenChalice: Большая, богато украшенная и блестящая чаша.
goldenRing: Золотое кольцо, скорее всего, используется как знак богатства и власти.
goldenSword: Богато украшенный, но мягкий меч, выкованный из цельного золота. Не подходит для боя из-за своей мягкости.
grassSeeds: Small dried grass seeds. Can be planted to grow grass.
ironOre: Unprocessed, raw iron ore. Can be smelted into ingots using a cast or worked with in a wrought iron form.
woodenDowels: A gathering of small wooden pegs. Used as hinges in woodworking or as kindling in firemaking.
largeRock: A rather large rock, handy for crafting many tools and devices.
leafBedroll: A provisional bed with poor insulation and scratchy half-dried leaves, used for sleeping or resting.
leatherHide: A fresh leather hide, stripped from an animal and de-furred.
leaves: A handful of foliage used as compost, to stoke a fire, or as tinder when dried.
limestone: A mineral-rich rock that can be ground into a powder. Useful for metal and glass production.
log: A sturdy piece of wood, useful for construction or as a fuel for a fire.
stoneMortarAndPestle: Used for grinding and crushing, made from smooth stones.
buttonMushrooms: Long lasting common white mushrooms. They appear safe to consume.
nopal: A de-spined cactus pad, filled with refreshing liquid and nutrition.
peat: A dried mass of sponge-like plants, great for fire fuel and composting.
sandstone: A soft, malleable rock, useful for construction and tool making.
pileOfGravel: A large pile of damp stone and sand.
pileOfSand: A large pile of moist sand, useful for making glass when refined.
woodenArrow: A provisional wooden projectile to be fired from a bow. Crafted with a feather to control flight.
stoneAxe: A simple stone axe used for chopping wood or as a carving implement.
bandage: A tattered piece of fabric, used to staunch wounds and prevent infection.
wovenFabric: A makeshift piece of fibrous tissue, woven together into fabric.
cactusNeedle: A needle from a cactus plant, useful in crafting smaller, more intricate items.
stoneShovel: A digging tool made of stone, used to collect different materials from the ground or to route water.
woodenSpear: A makeshift, easy to craft hunting weapon. Makes for an ideal ranged weapon.
suture: A sharp needle tool with an attached thin string, used to sew and close gaping wounds.
raft: A small, simple boat; a quicker alternative to swimming. Effective for traversing large expanses of water.
rawMeat: A raw, bloody chunk of meat. Cooking is recommended before consumption.
raspberries: Lush, ripe raspberries, plucked from a raspberry bush.
flyAmanita: An odd looking, and even odder smelling red spotted mushroom.
rope: A thick, twisted piece of cordage, useful for heavy-duty binding.
mapleSeeds: Small, winged seeds that seemingly dance and twirl in the air as they fall from a maple tree.
badderlocks: Волокнистые мокрые водоросли. Можно использовать в качестве верёвки или съесть.
sharpGlass: A semi-opaque shard of glass, formed after melting sand down.
sharpRock: A sharpened rock, useful for crafting, tool making, and carving when required.
skullcap: Выдолбленный череп животного, используемый в качестве простого шлема.
smoothRock: A round, smoothed rock, useful for many crafts.
soil: A pile of moist dirt. The heavy smell of earth permeates your nostrils when holding it.
stoneSpear: A hunting weapon crafted with a stone head, suitable as a throwing weapon.
stones: A mass of small rocks. Can be used for throwing or crafting.
stoneWall: A series of interlaced stones and rocks, shaped into a vertical wall structure. Can be built to keep enemies out.
string: Плетёный материал; основа всех ремесленных материалов, в основном используется для связывания.
strippedBark: Прочная, волокнистая, ободранная с веток, используется для изготовления верёвок.
tannedLeather: A durable, treated piece of leather. Used in crafting armor and other tools.
tannin: Естественный материал для обработки. Используется на шкурах для изготовления дублёной кожи.
milkThistleSeeds: Small hard seeds, used for growing milk thistle plants.
treeBark: A tough, dense chunk of bark, broken off from a tree. Can be used for kindling or stripping into cordage.
honeyFungus: A parasitic fungi, grown from a tree and possibly edible.
clematisVine: Длинный, вьющийся ломонос, подходит для изготовления верёвок.
twigs: Небольшая кучка палок и веток. Используется в основном для розжига.
waterskin: A portable water container, made from stitched leather.
woodenPole: Длинный кусок дерева, вырезанный и строганый в гладкую рейку из ветки или бревна.
peatBandage: A fabric bandage combined with peat as an effective antiseptic.
bow: Изогнутая деревянная жердь с короткой тетивой, натянутой на оба конца. Натяжение тетивы используется для стрельбы стрелами.
bowDrill: An advanced fire starting device. Uses the string on a bow to rotate into the wood, reducing much effort.
fishingNet: A checkered weave of string with weights on each corner, used to trap and catch fish.
rawCod: Slimy to the touch, but healthy and delicious to eat. Can be cooked for a better meal.
cookedCod: A seared, well-cooked cod, ready to consume and enjoy.
stoneCampfire: A grouping of rocks shaped into a ring to contain a fire.
vineWhip: Самодельное оружие, изготовленное из простых лоз, сплетённых вместе.
pileOfSnow: A melting snow pile. Useful to drink in desperate need, but be quick!
barkTorch: A torch wrapped and bound by stripped tree bark, providing natural oils to increase the life of the torch.
litBarkTorch: Provides light to your surroundings when equipped and can also be used to start other fires.
handDrill: A rudimentary fire making tool which uses a stick and another piece of wood. Both hands are used to twist the stick against wood, making friction to create an ember for the fire.
smallBag: A leather pouch used for holding a few items, carried at your waist, reducing encumbrance.
shale: A brittle but sharp carving implement.
sharpenedBone: A sharp bone, useful for carving other objects.
grindstone: A coarse rock useful for sanding, sharpening, and repairing other items.
rawFishSteak: A raw piece of fish, cut into a fillet. Good to eat as is, but is tastier cooked.
cookedFishSteak: A cooked fish fillet, seared on the outside and delicious.
waterskinOfDesalinatedWater: A waterskin full of freshly desalinated seawater.
boatPaddle: A makeshift boat paddle used with boats and rafts, or combat if in dire need.
bullBoat: A boat made from leather hides and framed with curved wooden poles. Used to travel to new, far away lands.
refinedSand: Мелко измельчённый песок, полезный в изготовлении стекла.
spyglass: An improvised, short-range telescope, which can be used to see slightly further away in any direction when equipped.
flask: A glass container which can be heated to use for desalination, a process used to make seawater drinkable.
rawClay: A soft, formable mud. Suitable for building materials, tool-making, and more.
rawClayBlowpipe: Необожжённая стеклодувная трубка, используемая в стеклодуве. Непригодно для использования, пока не обожжётся.
clayBlowpipe: Прочная стеклодувная трубка, используемая в стеклодуве.
leatherBelt: Made from tanned animal hide, cut, wrapped, and stitched together to tie around the waist.
leatherTunic: A leather garment which provides protection for the torso.
leatherBoots: Malleable yet tough foot protection, crafted from tanned animal hide.
leatherCap: A hat made of leather, double layered for extra sturdiness.
leatherGorget: A circlet of leather, bound in two, stitched together and used as neck protection.
leatherPants: Basic leather leggings with just enough padding to provide some leg protection.
leatherGloves: Leather-bound hand protection, crafted from tanned animal hide.
stoneFurnace: An enclosed structure made of stone, which traps in the heat to keep a long-lasting, high-temperature fire.
sandstoneKiln: Similar to a furnace, but constructed with sandstone and in a way that allows for proper heat distribution for crafting glass and clay items.
ironTongs: Durable iron tongs used to grab hot items, protecting your hands from damage.
talc: A very chalky mineral, only useful in its powder form.
talcumPowder: Chalky and abundantly absorbent to the touch. An agent required for casting of advanced metals.
sandCastFlask: A mold for casting metal into any shape, made with green sand.
lens: Glass formed into a partially convex shape. It allows focusing sunlight into a single location, creating enough heat for a fire.
plantRoots: A tangled mess of roots, with earth still hanging from the tips.
lockPick: An improvised needle and prong that should be strong enough to pick a lock or two.
boneNeedle: A thin, hard, sharp needle, carved from bone.
pineapple: A juicy, ripe pineapple, loaded with vitamins and thirst-quenching attributes.
tatteredMap: An old torn map covered with drawings and scribbles, a bit hard to make sense of on first glance.
coal: A black and brittle mineral, staining anything it touches, but useful as fuel.
wroughtIron: A heavily oxidized and unpurified form of iron, used in the forging of brittle tools, weapons, and armor.
limestonePowder: A white, mineral-dense powder used in glass tempering and the purifying of metals.
ironIngot: A solid brick of iron, ready to be formed or melted and cast in many ways.
backpack: Crafted with leather, it's suitable for holding many items on your back, reducing overall weight.
rottenMeat: Acrid decomposing animal tissue. You would not want to eat this, but can be used in compost.
stoneHammer: A rudimentary stone hammer, braced on the end of a pole with string. Used for gathering and repairing.
rawChicken: A small, plump and de-feathered chicken carcass, ready for cooking.
cookedChicken: A well-cooked chicken, ready to consume and sure to satisfy.
stoneAnvil: A solid stone anvil. Used in the production of metal armor, weapons, and tools.
woodenChest: A large wooden container that can fit many items while placed on the ground. Foods will decay slower within it.
ironSword: A strong, sharp blade designed for thrusting and slashing.
ironBreastplate: Durable, armor worn over the torso. One could take a serious beating while wearing this.
ironBoots: Heavy iron plated boots, shielding your feet from damage.
ironHelmet: Iron plated headgear designed to withstand heavy blows.
ironGorget: A round metal brace worn around the neck and over the shoulders.
ironGreaves: Iron leggings; to be strapped on and function as leg protection.
ironGauntlets: Iron gloves designed to be protective and durable, while maintaining as much flexibility as possible.
ironShield: A large and heavy iron shield, used for blocking projectiles or melee attacks.
sandstoneWall: A constructed wall built from mined sandstone.
sandstoneFlooring: A group of sandstone bricks, placed in a grid to be used as flooring.
spiderSilk: A delicate but strong strand of silk, produced by a spider. Can be used as cordage.
animalFat: A gelatinous shaving of animal fat, slimy to the touch. Useful as a rendered fuel.
animalFatTorch: A torch; wrapped in rendered animal fat, producing a long-lasting light source.
clayFlakes: Dried shavings of clay. Created by shaving clay and drying over a period of time.
greenSand: A form of malleable sand made with clay, used to make molds for metal casting.
oldInstructionalScroll: A tattered sheet of paper with some roughly scribbled instructions and diagrams.
slimeGelatin: A lump of slime gelatin which jiggles upon your touch. Can be used to preserve food, or melted down and used as glue.
glue: A natural form of glue that can be used to bind and reinforce items.
cookedSpiderMeat: Crispy spider meat. Not the best texture or flavor, but contains the more edible portions of the deceased arachnid.
spiderMeat: A spider's fleshy innards. It's hard to stomach, even when cooked. Try not to think about what you're eating.
ironLockPick: A pair of iron picks and wrenches, durable enough to pick the most adept of locks.
rottingVegetation: A stinking mash of organic plant matter, now usable as compost. Unless you want to risk eating it.
chives: A strong smelling and tasting plant, packed with nutrients and vitamins.
ironHammer: A strong hammer with an iron head, perfect for shaping and repairing items.
ironSpear: A polearm with a strong pointed tip forged from iron.
ironShovel: A heavy iron digging implement, lifting and breaking through even the toughest gravels and soils.
ironDoubleAxe: An axe with a forged, double sided head, ideal for both combat and gathering.
ironPickaxe: A robust mining implement, with a blade forged from iron.
inkstick: A hardened brick of ink, used for drawing and painting.
coconut: Волокнистый и тяжёлый плод. Сложен в употреблении, но содержит высококалорийную кокосовую мякоть и молочко.
palmLeaf: Большой лис с пальмы. Прочные внутренние волокна идеальны для верёвок.
offal: Кучка органов, тканей и других неприятных частей несчастного животного.
boneFragments: A bundle of bones from a small vertebrate. Some cracked, others shattered. The pieces are quite sharp.
litPoleTorch: A wooden pole that has been lit on fire. Not suitable for long journeys in the darkness.
cotton: A downy bundle of opened cotton seeds, the ideal solution for spinning thread and making fabrics.
cottonSeeds: De-fluffed and cleaned off cotton seeds, ready to plant.
cottonFabric: A soft piece of cloth spun from cotton.
bonePole: A smooth cudgel crafted from a large bone.
tourniquet: A hard stud twisted together with a string. Used to twist around a bleeding wound to stem the flow of blood.
wroughtIronPickaxe: A dual-headed mining implement. One head is heavy and blunt, the other, spiked to cut through rock with ease.
wroughtIronDoubleAxe: A dual-bladed axe which can provide enough slashing damage for both combat and gathering.
wroughtIronShovel: A shovel with an angled, pointed head, useful for digging and water routing.
wroughtIronSpear: A polearm with pointed head, crafted from wrought iron. Used in melee or thrown in combat.
wroughtIronHammer: A large mallet crafted from wrought iron. Useful for repairing and sometimes gathering.
wroughtIronLockPick: A set of picks and wrenches made from wrought iron, used for picking and unlocking locked devices.
wroughtIronShield: A sturdy wrought iron shield, made by bending large sheets of metal into shape.
wroughtIronGauntlets: Intricate and sturdy, these wrought iron gloves fit snugly on your hands.
wroughtIronGreaves: Wrought iron leggings, strapped and padded around the legs to reduce most damage.
wroughtIronGorget: A molded piece of metal, used to protect the area around the neck and shoulders.
wroughtIronHelmet: Using a barbute design, this iron helmet shields the head from most kinds of attacks.
wroughtIronBoots: Wrought iron footwear. Heavy and made specifically for protecting feet and lower legs.
wroughtIronBreastPlate: A large wrought iron chest plate, worn over the torso.
wroughtIronSword: A long, sharpened blade fitted into a solid hilt and forged from wrought iron. A good, strong weapon.
woodenWall: A sturdy set of bound logs, forming a protective wall that can be placed.
woodenFlooring: Wooden floor boards; planed to equal height and length.
woodenDoor: A door crafted from long wooden planks with large wooden hinges. Can be opened and closed when built.
fishingRod: A flexible, smooth wooden rod with a string line and sharpened hook. Used for fly fishing.
messageInABottle: An old cloudy bottle with an unidentified object contained inside.
pileOfCompost: A mix of decaying organic matter, full of chemical nutrients and great for growing plants with when combined with soil.
meltedAmber: Warmed amber resin; used to create a hardened bind when cooled on to an object.
woodenShavings: A dry bunch of wooden shavings, used to ignite kindling when starting a fire.
deadfall: A large, flat rock, propped up with a stick. Once set, anything that triggers it will be crushed or injured from the falling rock.

waterskinOfMedicinalWater: A soothing mixture of plants and roots. Used to heal poisons and illnesses.

woodenTongs: A pair of simple wood tongs, used to pick up hot objects without injury.
wroughtIronTongs: A pair of tongs, forged from wrought iron. Used to lift hot objects without injury.
sheetOfGlass: A cloudy tempered piece of glass. Practical for many optical tools and other simple devices used to harness the sun.

litAnimalFatTorch: A bright burning, pleasant smelling torch. Made with a pole and long lasting, rendered animal fat.

longBow: Nearly as tall as the average person, this bow is designed for maximum range.

glassBottle: A transparent vessel with a cork for containment. Used for collecting water.

glassBottleOfPurifiedFreshWater: glass bottle of purified fresh water
Potable, and safe to hydrate yourself with. The water has been purified reducing any toxins and unsafe bacteria.
glass bottles of purified fresh water
glassBottleOfUnpurifiedFreshWater: glass bottle of unpurified fresh water
A bottle containing water that is likely unfit to drink. It will quench your thirst, but may have negative side-effects until it's purified.
glass bottles of unpurified fresh water

ironArrow: An arrow tipped with a high-quality iron arrowhead. Fletched with feathers to stabilize flight and accuracy.

leatherSling: A sling crafted from tanned leather. Designed to hold a projectile to be thrown at an increased velocity.
wroughtIronArrowhead: Forged with wrought iron, this arrowhead is used to craft an arrow. In dire need, it could also be used for carving.
ironArrowhead: An expertly forged iron arrowhead, used to create arrows. Alternatively, can be used to carve if necessary.
hammock: A comfortable place to sleep, although not too sturdy. Crafted by bound cordage and usually hung off of the ground.
cottonBedroll: A soft and downy sleeping mattress, rolled up for ease of carrying. Can be used to sleep or rest very comfortably.
featherBedroll: A bedroll made with soft feathers and wrapped in fabric. Used for resting and sleeping in comfort.
rawTaintedMeat: A piece of bad-smelling meat, possibly diseased or tainted with parasites. Possible to consume, but could be deadly.
cookedTaintedMeat: A piece of discolored meat, cooked to kill possible toxins, but possibly still unsafe for consumption.
stoneKnife: A sharpened piece of stone, carved into a blade, with a handle for support. Can be used as a weapon, gathering tool or to carve.
rawBlindfish: An odd-looking fish with no eyes. Very slimy to the touch.
cookedBlindfish: While the source of the food is a bit suspect, after being cooked, it appears to be more palatable.
pemmican: A ball of dried ground meat. With a long shelf life, this is the ultimate survival food. For the best benefits, prepare it with animal fat.
preparedPemmican: A seasoned mound of dried ground meat, fried and cooked with fat for maximum flavor and caloric content.
sail: A large piece of fabric, woven together to be attached to a mast. Used on a sailboat to propel it along the sea.
sailboat: A large one-man boat. Used to traverse large expanses of water and for travel back to civilization.
egg: A brown colored egg, laid by a chicken. Can be eaten as is, or cooked for a tastier meal.
boiledEgg: A moist, delicious boiled egg. Great tasting and packed with protein.
sheafOfHay: Long and almost sharp to the touch. These grass stalks are perfect for string making, animal feed, or tinder when dried.
niter: A natural mineral, ground up to be used as a preservative or for other chemical applications.
saltpeter: A ground mineral, to be used as a natural food preservative. If combined with other minerals, it can be combustible.
blackPowder: A highly combustible powder, made up of a combination of minerals.
flintlockPistol: A long range, high damage pistol. Requires black powder and bullets to fire.
giblets: A batch of cooked animal organs. Considerably repugnant, but nutritious and filling.
explosiveTrap: A mound of leaves used to conceal a volatile explosive powder. Stepping on it will trigger a small explosion.
skeletalMageWand: A mysterious, gnarled staff with a twinkling red gemstone attached to the end.
rawClayJug: A formed and sculpted jug molded from raw clay. Requires a cork and a kiln to be fired and hardened.
clayJug: A fully hardened clay jug with a cork. Used to hold water.
clayJugOfSeawater: Unfiltered seawater, held in a clay jug. Unsuitable to drink in its current form but could be desalinated.
clayJugOfDesalinatedWater: Potable, safe-to-drink water. The water in this clay jug has gone through the desalination process.
clayJugOfMedicinalWater: A clay jug containing medicinal water, used to cure and soothe certain ailments while also replenishing your thirst.
clayJugOfPurifiedFreshWater: clay jug of purified fresh water
A clay jug filled with fresh, purified water. Can be used to quench your thirst.
clay jugs of purified fresh water
clayJugOfUnpurifiedFreshWater: clay jug of unpurified fresh water
A clay jug full of natural, fresh water. Although it is drinkable, further purification is recommended.
clay jugs of unpurified fresh water
rawClayBrick: A soft piece of raw clay, molded into a rectangle. Ready to be fired inside a kiln.
clayBrick: A hardened clay brick, used in the building of structures such as floors and walls.
clayBrickWall: A wall made from clay bricks, set into a typical skewed, grid-like fashion to increase durability.
clayBrickFlooring: Flooring crafted from clay bricks. Could be used as decoration or as part of a building.
pineappleSeeds: Small brown seeds that can be planted to grow into pineapple plants.
raspberrySeeds: Seeds that will grow into a raspberry bush, given enough time and care.
pricklyPearSeeds: These appear to be prickly pear seeds. Can be planted to grow cacti or eaten.
clematisSeeds: Seeds to grow clematis. Can be eaten if desperate, but they do not contain any significant nutrition.
paperSheet: A large piece of paper. It appears to contain many recycled fibers. Suitable for drawing on with ink.
paperMold: A mold used for making paper. Contains a screen that holds wet recycled fibers to dry and press into flattened, usable paper.
beggarticks: The flower and stems of beggarticks. Only useful in creating medicinal tonics, or ingesting directly if food supply is low.
milkThistleFlowers: The flowering bulbs of a milk thistle plant. Filled with a bitter but nutritious milk.
drawnMap: A paper sheet, scrawled with geographical landmarks and features. Used to approximate a location when read.
tatteredShirt: Некогда прекрасный кусок одежды, а теперь разорванный.
tatteredPants: Brown colored pants, now reduced to shorts from distress and wear.
woodenGate: A gate crafted from long wooden planks with small wooden hinges. Can be opened and closed when built.
poisonIvyLeaves: Causes irritation to the touch; these leaves of three do not belong on your person.
poisonIvySeeds: Bright green, soft seeds, used to plant to grow into poison ivy.
wroughtIronChest: A spacious container built from wrought iron that can store many items. Foods will spoil slower inside of it.
ironChest: A large iron chest that is both roomy and sturdy. Foods contained within will decay at a slower rate.
switchgrassSeeds: Long dried grass seeds. Can be planted to grow a longer type of grass.
apple: A juicy, delicious red apple. The fruit contains seeds to grow apple trees.
spiderEggs: Soft and squishy to the touch. These small silken eggs contain arachnid life inside.
tailFeathers: A fluffy clump of white feathers, removed from an avian creature's backside.
appleSeeds: Still scented like the apples they come from, these small brown seeds are used for planting to grow into apple trees.
venomGland: The venom producing gland of a snake, still filled with some immobilizing venom.
ornateWoodenChest: A decorative wooden container gilded with symbols inlaid into the wood.
rollOfRedCarpet: A rolled-up piece of red carpet, suitable for making a comfortable living space or welcoming important guests.
ornateCape: A red and gold stitched cape, which drapes the back and fastens at the neck. Worn as a status symbol.
fireBladder: An oddly shaped organ from a fire-breathing creature. Hot to the touch; it appears to contain a deadly chemical reaction inside.
goldenKey: A large and decorative key forged from gold.
woodenSword: A sturdy blunt sword, crafted from wood with a sharp piercing point. Most useful for sparring practice.
clayKiln: Similar to a furnace, but constructed with clay and in a way that allows for proper heat distribution for crafting glass and clay items.
clayCampfire: A grouping of clay bricks shaped into a ring to contain a fire.
clayFurnace: An enclosed structure made of clay bricks, which traps in the heat to keep a long-lasting, high-temperature fire.
clayWaterStill: A carved-out clay brick with a lid. It's used to desalinate water by boiling it and then collecting the steam into a separate container.
sandstoneCampfire: A grouping of sandstone shaped into a ring to contain a fire.
sandstoneFurnace: An enclosed structure made of sandstone, which traps in the heat to keep a long-lasting, high-temperature fire.
sandstoneWaterStill: A hollowed-out piece of sandstone with a lid. It's used to desalinate water by boiling it and then collecting the steam into a separate container.
stoneKiln: Similar to a furnace, but constructed with rocks and in a way that allows for proper heat distribution for crafting glass and clay items.
wroughtIronAnvil: An anvil made from wrought iron with a wooden base. Useful for metalworking.
ironAnvil: A sturdy iron anvil. Used in the production of metal armor, weapons, tools, and more.
mageRobe: An ancient tattered robe, once owned by a spell casting foe.
orbOfInfluence: A strange spherical orb that gives off a shimmering radiance on your touch. It appears to hum as you hold it.
animalClaw: A sharp claw from an animal. A perfect animal by-product for using as a needle.
animalPelt: The remains of an unlucky skinned animal. Can be used as a makeshift garment or dismantled into the hide and fur separately.
animalFur: A large clump of animal fur and hair. Could be used as tinder in a situation where wood is not available.
scales: Dried and hardened scales from a reptilian creature. Can be used as a rudimentary fabric.
sharkFin: Not much more than a trophy, this carved dorsal fin remains slippery and rubbery to the touch.
rawReptileMeat: A grainy piece of edible reptile flesh. Generally, not safe to consume without being cooked due to bacteria.
cookedReptileMeat: A grilled piece of reptile meat. The look and texture could almost be passed as chicken.
tentacles: A slimy, wriggling appendage from an unlucky cephalopod. Can be eaten, but with some force due to the rubbery unpleasant texture.
cookedTentacles: Although, still springy to the touch, this cooked cephalopod appendage can be stomached much easier than if raw.
wormMeat: Essentially a mash of worm innards, almost ground up into a paste. Definitely not the most appetizing, but can be cooked for better flavor.
cookedWormMeat: A cooked patty of worm meat. Unappetizing to think about, but can provide as a good source of needed nutrition.
stonePickaxe: A primitive stone pickaxe used for mining into rock or as a stopgap blunt weapon.
wroughtIronAxe: An axe forged out of wrought iron, primarily used for lumberjacking and carving.
ironAxe: An iron-forged axe used in wood chopping. Its sharp end can be used for crafting and carving.
fertileSoil: A rich soil, suitable for setting down to attempt to grow plants on for maximum fertility.
stoneHoe: A rudimentary tilling and gardening tool, used to break up soil for more successful growth of plants.
wroughtIronHoe: A long pole with a wrought iron metal blade attached to the end. Used to till the ground for planting seeds.
ironHoe: A long-handled gardening tool with a blade on the end, forged from iron. Used to till soil for better plant growth.
lavaBeetleHelmet: An extremely hard and fire-resistant helmet, sourced from the carcass of a fallen lava beetle.
spruceCone: A prickly cone from a spruce tree, filled with seeds contained inside its scales.
spruceSeeds: White seeds for growing a spruce tree, ejected from a spruce cone.
spruceNeedles: Dense, needled branches from a spruce tree. Useful for compost or drying out for tinder.
cypressCone: A rounded cone from a cypress tree, containing seeds.
cypressSeeds: Sharp to the touch, these seeds can be used for growing cypress trees.
cypressLeaves: Flat bladed foliage from a cypress tree. Can be used for tinder or compost when dried out.
lettuce: This leafy green vegetable is rich in vitamins and quite filling when eaten.
lettuceSeeds: Seeds taken from lettuce that has turned to seed.
chiveSeeds: The small black appearance of these seeds suggests they are for growing chives.
potato: Starchy edible tubers. Not suitable for consumption without cooking due to toxicity.
potatoSeeds: An alternative way to grow potatoes without using seed potatoes. These will grow into a potato plant seedling.
carrot: A healthy looking root vegetable, orange in color and full of nutrients. Both the taproot and leaves are edible.
carrotSeeds: Seeds for growing carrots, taken from seeding carrot flowers.
cornEar: An ear of corn, wrapped in its husk; ready to be shucked and cooked, or eaten raw.
cornSeeds: Dried and aged corn kernels, used for planting and growing corn stalks.
cucumber: A cucumiform gourd fruit, grown from a creeping vine. Full of nutrients and packed with water content.
cucumberSeeds: Seeds taken from inside the fruit of a cucumber.
tomato: Red, plump and juicy, this savory fruit can be eaten raw for replenishment of hunger as well as some thirst.
tomatoSeeds: Seeds from a tomato, ready for planting and germination to grow into tomato plants.
pumpkin: A heavy orange squash, filled with edible pulp. Contains seeds for growing more.
pumpkinSeeds: Large, flat pumpkin seeds. Can be shelled and eaten or planted as is.
pricklyPearFruit: The fruiting body of a prickly pear cactus. The insides are extremely red and juicy.
sugarCaneStalks: Stout, jointed, fibrous stalks that are rich in the sugar content. They can be quite long and the insides can be chewed on for sustenance.
sugarCaneSeeds: Seeds for planting and growing crops of sugar cane stalks.
bushelOfWheat: The clipped remains of the stalk and grains from wheat grass.
wheat: The hulled spikelets from wheat grass, containing the raw grains.
cookedPotato: A skin-on cooked potato; soft and mushy and packed with calories.
cookedCornCob: A well cooked cob of corn. Ready to consume and enjoy.
bundleOfSwitchgrass: Bundled up switchgrass stalks, complete with its seeds.
cloak: An old, but sturdy hooded cloak garment. It appears to be of high quality from a bygone era.
woodenMortarAndPestle: Carved from wood; this makeshift device can be used for crushing up items.
sandstoneMortarAndPestle: A mortar and pestle carved from sandstone, used to grind up other items.
wroughtIronMortarAndPestle: Used for pulverizing items, forged from wrought iron.
ironMortarAndPestle: Forged from iron; this device can be used for crushing and grinding other items.
rawClayMortarAndPestle: An unfired mortar and pestle, used as a grinding device when hardened.
clayMortarAndPestle: A grinding device made from fired and cured clay.
copperOre: Raw copper ore with a tinge of oxidation. Can be smelted into ingot form with a cast.
copperIngot: A dense, formed brick of copper. Slag and other impurifies have been removed, making it useful for forging into tools, weapons, and armor.
copperPickaxe: A copper pick tool, primarily used for gathering rocks and stones; however, copper may not the best choice for such a tool.
copperDoubleAxe: An almost lumbering and unwieldy copper weapon and tool.
copperShovel: A copper digging tool, used for lifting soils or resource gathering.
copperSpear: A long piercing weapon with a copper spearhead.
copperHammer: Although copper tends to be quite malleable, this copper hammer will do the trick in most cases for repair and other crafts.
copperLockPick: A small and precise device used for picking locks, made with refined copper ore.
copperShield: A rounded copper offhanded armor piece. Copper can be an ideal material for taking a beating with such a design.
copperGauntlets: Complex and intricate, but still fairly durable. These copper hand armor pieces are used to block damage to your extremities.
copperGreaves: Sturdy copper leggings that can be tied around your legs, shielding them from damage.
copperGorget: A shiny copper neck protection piece.
copperHelmet: A piece of copper-forged head armor, designed with ancient sensibilities.
copperBoots: Copper-forged boots, shaped and crafted to fit closely to your feet size.
copperBreastPlate: Formed in a classic abdominal design, this copper breastplate can protect your torso from damage.
copperSword: A sharp and pristine-looking copper forged blade, designed for close quarter combat.
copperTongs: Tongs crafted from copper, used to grasp hot objects, protecting your hands and fingers.
copperArrow: A fletched arrow, made with feathers and a copper arrowhead.
copperBullet: A solid copper bullet. Used as ammunition for slings and other ranged weaponry.
copperArrowhead: A sharp pointed arrowhead, forged from copper. Can be used as a carving implement.
copperChest: A roomy copper chest, used for caching items and food storage, reducing spoilage.
copperAnvil: A heavy shaped slab of copper perched on a wooden base, used in the production of metal weapons, tools, and armor.
copperAxe: The perfect tool for tree chopping and gathering. This copper-bladed implement can also be used in carving and crafts that require a sharp tool.
copperHoe: A gardening tool used to till ground. This tool is forged with copper.
copperMortarAndPestle: Used as a grinding and crushing tool. This mortar and pestle is forged from solid copper.
waterskinOfGoatMilk: A filled leather waterskin containing the raw milk from a goat.
clayJugOfGoatMilk: A clay jug full of nutritious raw goat milk.
glassBottleOfGoatMilk: A bottled batch of goat milk, filled to the top of this glass bottle.
obsidian: An extremely sharp and hard shard of obsidian, useful for cutting, but very brittle.
ornateBlueBook: An expensive looking book with a blue hard cover. The insides and back have heavy wear on inspection.
journal: A leather-bound soft journal. It appears it has seen a lot of use over time.
mossCoveredBook: A book that has seen better days. It smells of mold and earth and seems fragile.
gildedRedBook: An old, fancy looking book with a red cover, gilded with golden trim.
arrowShaft: A whittled down pole, used for the shaft of a fletched arrow.
slitherSucker: A living, writhing slither sucker, constricting itself to you, causing pain as it sinks its teeth into you.
aberrantSlitherSucker: A living, writhing aberrant slither sucker, constricting itself to you, causing pain as it sinks its teeth into you.

reaperOfSouls: Убить 50 призраков-пиратов и собрать их тела.
treasureHunter: Выкопать или выловить 10 сундуков с сокровищами.
explorer: Наступить или собрать каждый вид плитки.
prepared: Надеть что-нибудь в каждый слот снаряжения.
seafarer: Уплыть к цивилизации и завершить игру.
navigator: Пересечь моря в поисках новых земель.
treasurer: Собрать каждый из пяти видов сокровищ.
pulchritudinous: Надеть легендарный предмет в каждый слот снаряжения.
talented: Достичь 1000% в сумме для всех навыков.

chemistry: • Влияет на качество и успешность изготовления предметов с использованием химических смесей.
anatomy:
• Повышает точность описания здоровья существа, сопротивления и уязвимости.
  • Снижает вероятность получения кровотечения, отравления и горения от существ.
  • Повышает эффективность лечебных расходных материалов.
  • Повышает вероятность успеха исцеления.
  • Снижает вероятность кровотечения при использовании голых рук во время боя/сбора.
archery: • Повышает урон, точность и максимальную дальность при использовании луков и огнестрела.
blacksmithing: • Влияет на качество, ремонт и показатель успеха изготовления предметов из металла.
botany:
• Повышает вероятность успешной посадки растения.
  • Повышает эффективность употребления в пищу растительных расходных материалов.
  • Снижает вероятность вытаптывания растений при наступлении на них.
  • Повышает шансы сбора ресурсов с растений.
  • Снижает вероятность снижения выносливости во время сбора растений.
  • Снижает время прорастания семян.
camping:
• Повышает число ходов на сон при использовании спальника.
  • Повышает вероятность розжига огня.
  • Повышает точность измерения времени с помощью солнечных часов.
cartography:
• Повышает вероятность успешного чтения разорванных карт.
  • Снижает неясность при чтении разорванных карт.
claythrowing: • Влияет на качество и успешность изготовления предметов из глины.
cooking:
• Влияет на качество и успешность приготовления блюд (через ремесло).
  • Влияет на распад приготовленных продуктов.
fishing:
• Повышает верояность успеха при ловле рыбы. Повышает максимальную дальность при использовании удочки.
  • Повышает расстояние, на которым вы можете собрать морские сокровища.
fletching: • Влияет на качество и скорость починки изготовленный стрел, луков и пращ.
glassblowing: • Влияет на качество и успешность изготовления предметов из стекла.
leatherworking: • Влияет на качество, ремонт и показатель успеха изготовления предметов из кожи.
lumberjacking:
• Повышает вероятность сбора ресурсов с деревьев.
  • Снижает вероятность снижения выносливости во время лесничества.
mining:
• Повышает вероятность сбора ресурсов при ударе по камню/песчанику или во время копания.
  • Снижает вероятность снижения выносливости во время добычи или копания.
  • Повышает расстояние, на которым вы можете собрать сокровища.
mycology:
• Повышает вероятность посадки гриба.
  • Повышает эффективность употребления в пищу грибных расходных материалов.
  • Снижает вероятность вытаптывания грибов при наступлении на них.
  • Повышает вероятность сбора ресурсов с грибов.
  • Снижает вероятность снижения выносливости во время сбора грибов.
  • Снижает время прорастания спор.
parrying:
• Повышает базовое значение защиты при держании предметов в каждой руке.
  • Повышает вероятность получить меньше урона в бою.
  • Снижает вероятность снижения выносливости при получении урона.
stonecrafting: • Влияет на качество, ремонт и показатель успеха изготовления предметов из камня.
swimming:
• Повышает скорость перемещения в воде.
  • Снижает вероятность снижения выносливости в воде.
tactics:
• Повышает базовое значение атаки.
  • Повышает верояность нанести удар по цели в бою.
  • Снижает вероятность снижения выносливости во время атаки.
tailoring: • Влияет на качество, ремонт и показатель успеха изготовления предметов из ткани и кожи.
throwing: • Повышает урон, точность и максимальную дальность при метании и броске предметов.
tinkering: • Влияет на качество, ремонт и показатель успеха изготовления предметов из прочих ресурсы с применением прочих методов.
trapping:
• Повышает наносимый урон и успешность срабатывания ловушки на существах.
  • Снижает верояность попадания в ловушки и получаемый от них урон.
woodworking: • Влияет на качество, ремонт и показатель успеха изготовления предметов из дерева.
taming:
• Повышает вероятность успешного приручения существа.
  • Повышает длительность контроля прирученного существа.
  • Снижает вероятность снижения выносливости при приручении/подкормке/дойке.
  • Снижает показатель снижения счастья при дойке коз.
  • Повышает верояность приручения при подкормке существ нестандартными предметами.
gardening:
• Повышает вероятность успешных вспашки или сбора урожая.
  • Снижает вероятность снижения выносливости во время вспашки или сбора урожая.
  • Влияет на качество и успешность изготовления предметов, требующих навыков садоводства.

fire: A dangerous open flame providing heat and light.
honeyFungus: A parasitic tree fungus that can grow and spread on living, decaying, and dead plant material.

menuAboutGameDescription: Wayward является сложным пошаговой, с видом сверху и выживанием в пустоши рогаликом. Исследуйте, стройте и, самое главное, выживайте в этих неумолимых землях.

menuNewGameChoiceDifficultyCasualDescrip: Умирая, вы будете возрождаться в месте, где спали или отдыхали последний раз. Все предметы будут выброшены на месте вашей смерти.
menuNewGameChoiceDifficultyHardcoreDescr: Непростительный режим по умолчанию. Смерть игрока будет необратимой.
menuNewGameChoiceDifficultyDailyChalleng: Используйте случайное зерно, которое меняется каждые 24 часа. Этот режим отличается низкой начальной репутацией, низкими навыками, меньшим количеством предметов и сложными начальными существами для экстремального испытания. Навыки растут в четыре раза быстрее. Сохранения отключены в этом режиме.
menuNewGameChoiceMultiplayerDescription: Позвольте друзьям присоединиться к вашему миру. Ограничивается режимом ходов в реальном времени.
menuNewGameChoiceTurnsManualDescription: Ходы совершаются только при каком-либо действии игрока.
menuNewGameChoiceTurnsRealTimeDescriptio: Ходы совершаются автоматически по прошествии времени.

menuOptionsButtonAutoGatherTooltip: Если флажок установлен, вы будете автоматический собирать ресурсы при перемещении на плитку с ресурсами.
menuOptionsButtonAutoPickupTooltip: Если флажок установлен, вы будете автоматически подбирать предметы при перемещении по ним.
menuOptionsButtonDropOnGatherTooltip: Если флажок установлен, вы будете автоматически бросать предметы при сборе их.
menuOptionsButtonKeepSortActiveTooltip: Если флажок установлен, ваш инвентарь будет сортироваться автоматически по мере заполнения.
menuOptionsButtonProtectedCraftingItemsT: Если флажок установлен, снаряжение и предметы в быстрых слотах не будут использоваться в ремесле.
menuOptionsButtonWarnOnDangerousActionsT: Если флажок установлен, будет появляться окно подтверждения при наступлении на декорации или объекты, которые могут поранить вас.
menuOptionsButtonWarnWhenBreakingItemsOn: Если флажок установлен, будет появляться окно подтверждения при попытке изготовить используемые предметы, которые будут ломаться при неудаче.
Если флажок установлен, будет появляться окно подтверждения при попытке использовать повреждённые предметы, которые будут ломаться при использовании.

menuSharedMultiplayerChoiceLobbyTypeFrie: Любой желающий может быть приглашён на сервер, а игра будет видна и доступна для захода вашим друзьям.
menuSharedMultiplayerChoiceLobbyTypePubl: Игра будет видна и доступна для захода всем желающим.
menuSharedMultiplayerChoiceLobbyTypePriv: Единственный способ для игроков, чтобы присоединиться к игре - быть приглашённым.
menuSharedRealTimeTickSpeedTooltip: Время, необходимое для совершения тика, когда игра запущена в реальном времени.
steamworksInterruptURLOpenedInBrowser: URL будет открыть в вашем браузере по умолчанию.
steamworksInterruptWorkshopOpenedInBrows: Мастерская Steam будет открыта в браузере.
Нажмите ОК после того, как завершите просмотр мастерской.
steamworksInterruptModWithNameAlreadyExi: Мод с таким названием уже существует. Попробуйте изменить название слота.
steamworksInterruptModImportSaveGameFail: Не удалось импортировать сохранение из мода «_0_».
optionsAutoGatherTooltip: Если флажок установлен, вы будете автоматический собирать ресурсы при перемещении на плитку с ресурсами.
optionsAutoPickupTooltip: Если флажок установлен, вы будете автоматически подбирать предметы при перемещении по ним.
optionsDropOnGatherTooltip: Если флажок установлен, вы будете автоматически бросать предметы при сборе их.
optionsDropItemsOnFacingTileTooltip: Если флажок установлен, брошенные предметы будут размещаться перед вами.
optionsDropItemsAtFeetTooltip: Если флажок установлен, брошенные предметы будут размещаться под ногами.
optionsDropItemsAtFeetWhenFacingTileBloc: Если флажок установлен, брошенные предметы будут размещаться перед вами, если только плитка не заблокирована, в этом случае они будут размещаться под ногами.
optionsKeepSortActiveTooltip: Если флажок установлен, ваш инвентарь будет сортировать автоматически по мере заполнения.
optionsProtectedCraftingItemsTooltip: Если флажок установлен, снаряжение и предметы в быстрых слотах не будут использовать в ремесле.
optionsWarnOnDangerousActionsTooltip: Если флажок установлен, будет появляться окно подтверждения при наступании на декорации или объекты, которые могут поранить вас.
optionsWarnWhenBreakingItemsOnCraft: Предупреждать при поломке предметов при изготовлении
optionsWarnWhenBreakingItemsOnCraftToolt: Если флажок установлен, будет появляться окно подтверждения при попытке изготовить используемые предметы, которые будут ломаться при неудаче.
optionsWarnWhenBreakingItemsTooltip: Если флажок установлен, будет появляться окно подтверждения при попытке использовать повреждённые предметы, которые будут ломаться при использовании.
